title: Nigeria: IPMAN Alleges Blackmail Against Its President
text:
Nigeria: Boko Haram - Ihejirika, Other Retired Generals Call for Reinvigoration of Training, Logistics 
He said, the association would cooperate with government institutions or agencies for a better society but would not condone any act of blackmail or witch hunting. 
According to him, the allegation that the association's President vandalised the associations Secretariat was a set up, stressing that those being accused of such acts are men of integrity. 
"We are therefore surprised that some people can go to such extent to blackmail others, the alleged break in and vandalization cannot be said to be true since all these men have free‎ accesses to the Secretariat at their conveniences." 
The PRS said although the IPMAN would support the government to fight criminality, but would not fold their arms when certain characters are using the government apparatus to humiliate others. 
The association believed that the Attorney General and Inspector General of police are aware of this in-justice on their President and his men, and urged them to make sure that the facts of the case are fully established. 
The Association supports the Federal Government efforts of trying to bring sanitary to the governance and administration of not only government affairs but all facets of our collective endeavours. 
The IPMAN official reiterated that, in the event that their doubt and fear are not fully addressed within a reasonable time and such intimidation and blackmail continues, it will not hesitate to call on it's members in protest to shut down their filing stations to fight such injustice. Nigeria
